text: The 1980 Montreal Expos season was the 12th season in franchise history. == Offseason == * December 7, 1979: Dan Schatzeder was traded by the Expos to the Detroit Tigers for Ron LeFlore.Ron LeFlore page at Baseball Reference * December 6, 1979: Rowland Office was signed as a free agent by the Expos.Rowland Office page at Baseball Reference * January 11, 1980: Mike Sharperson was drafted by the Expos in the 2nd round of the 1980 Major League Baseball Draft (Secondary Phase), but did not sign.Mike Sharperson page at Baseball Reference * March 15, 1980: Duffy Dyer was traded by the Expos to the Detroit Tigers for Jerry Manuel.Jerry Manuel page at Baseball Reference * March 15, 1980: Joe Pettini was sent by the Expos to the San Francisco Giants to complete an earlier deal (John Tamargo was traded by the Giants to the Expos for a player to be named later and cash).Joe Pettini page at Baseball Reference * March 18, 1980: Jim Mason was released by the Expos.Jim Mason page at Baseball Reference * March 31, 1980: Rusty Staub was traded by the Expos to the Texas Rangers for La Rue Washington and Chris Smith.Rusty Staub page at Baseball Reference ==Spring training== In 1980, the Expos held spring training at City Island Ball Park in Daytona Beach, Florida, for the final time. It was their eighth season there. For spring training the following season, they would return to West Palm Beach Municipal Stadium in West Palm Beach, Florida, where they previously had trained from 1969 through 1972. == Regular season == On June 8, during a doubleheader against the St. Louis Cardinals, the Expos played against two different Cardinals managers: Ken Boyer, who was fired between games, and his replacement, Jack Krol. === Season standings === === Record vs. opponents === === Opening Day starters === *Gary Carter *Warren Cromartie *Andre Dawson *Ron LeFlore *Larry Parrish *Scott Sanderson *Rodney Scott *Chris Speier *Ellis Valentine http://baseball- almanac.com/teamstats/roster.php?y=1980&t;=MON === Notable transactions === * June 3, 1980: 1980 Major League Baseball Draft **Drafted Terry Francona in the 1st round (22nd pick).Terry Francona page at Baseball Reference **Drafted Tom Gorman in the 4th round.Tom Gorman page at Baseball Reference **Drafted Roy Johnson in the 5th round.Roy Johnson page at Baseball Reference **Drafted Chris Sabo in the 30th round, but he did not sign.Chris Sabo page at Baseball Reference * August 11, 1980: Acquired John D'Acquisto and cash from the San Diego Padres in exchange for a player to be named later.
